author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Southern Bench of the NGT has directed the Chennai Metropolitan Water Supply and Sewerage Board (Metrowater) to restrain the discharge of sewage into stormwater drains across the city.

Disposing of a plea filed by East Kamaraj Nagar (North) Residents Welfare Association, the Bench comprising Justice M. Chockalingam and expert member P.S. Rao also directed Chennai Police Commissioner to grant permission to the Chennai Corporation for construction of more drains.

The Bench also directed Tangedco to complete all works with respect to the electrical cables, pipes, etc. During the hearing, it came to light that the sanitary inspector in the area had identified illegal sewer connections at the time of inspection of stormwater drains and action was taken under Tamil Nadu Public Health Act, 1939.
title: NGT directive to Metrowater
